metadata.Title: CVE-2018-4117 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 11.3 is affected. Safari before 11.1 is affected. iCloud before 7.4 on Windows is affected. iTunes before 12.7.4 on Windows is affected. watchOS before 4.3 is affected. The issue involves the fetch API in the "WebKit" component. It allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy and obtain sensitive information via a crafted web site.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-4117` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.20.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.20.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.20.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.20.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.20.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.20.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
